My Tech Stack

Frontend HTML5 , CSS/SASS/SCSS , BootStrap , JavaScript , VueJS , Nuxt.js
Backend Node.js , Express , JavaScript , REST API
Database MangoDB , MySQL , SQLite
Additional Skills Google Ads , Facebook Ads , Search Engine Optimisation, wordpress elementor
Tools Git , Postman , VS Code

Projects

MazoetHub - Fuel price email alert Saas

In 2022, energy prices were skyrocketed. Heating oil price rises almost from 100%. I'm a heating oil user to warm my home. Most of the time, I'll check price of oil when the heating oil (Kerosene) tanks were empty or when I don't have warm water. With huge price surge, I had to come with some kind of solution to stay touch with the price changes.  Before I developed MazoetHub, I used to google fuel price in my province manually.  I wanted to automate this process and update the prices through mail. 

Build a Secure API for a Review App

The initial idea behind this project is to build a secure back-end API - following 'OWASP' best practices. It is written in VanillaJS with the use of 'NEM' stack: Node.js with Express, MongoDB (NoSQL) for storing user auth/activities and Mongoose for data modelling. Also includes JWT for tokenising and parsing, dotenv for environmental variables. Includes CORS.

SEO for web development

Following the accessibility and search engine optimisation best practices, this existing website went through a thorough audit by me. During this audit, I've been using the Google Lighthouse Tool, so I could save and provide for comparison a 'before' and 'after' result. I also used W3C and CSS validator for the correction of any errors. Changes/improvements I've made are all has been documented.

E-commerce website with JavaScript Frontend app

This front-end demo project has been built with semantic HTML, Bootstrap v4+ (custom-styled with SCSS) and JavaScript (VanillaJS). The site elements are dynamically changing with the use of VanillaJS. Connected to an existing back-end and its API, which provides the relevant content - cameras and their details - to the front-end. Local storage is used for storing items added to cart (waiting to be submitted to back-end), session storage in use for storing order-confirmation details (data received from back-end). Storages are used for demo purpose.

Weather Application

Simple, yet fully functional weather app with Vanilla JavaScript created by myself for learning purposes and also to upgrade my skills. I have used HTML, SASS, and javascript for this App. By completing this project I’ve learned how to work with Date objects, Api and manipulate DOM

Internal Social-Media application for Employees - Vue MEVN Full Stack CRUD Web Application

Last project on the path. I've spent a bit more than 3 months on this project - as a beginner developer - to maximize the reusability for the future. This full-stack project is a secured, scalable, responsive Single Page Application. I've built a social-media web application with - on the front-end - the use of Vue.js (Vue-CLI) and Bulma (custom-styled with SCSS), VanillaJS for functions and algorithms, Vuex for state management, Vue-router for routing user navigation, Axios and Fetch for handling HTTP requests, and with - on the back-end - the use of Node.js with Express, MySql for storing user auth/activities and Sequelize for data modelling. Also includes JWT for tokenising and parsing, dotenv for environmental variables. Includes CORS. Follows the 'OWASP' and 'WCAG' best practices.
